We have class LlamaIndexCallbackHandler. Docstring: "Base callback handler that can be used to track event starts and ends."

Methods: __init__, _get_parent_id, _noop, on_event_end, on_event_start. All simple helpers.

We need to summarize class responsibility and state/behavior. Not list method names verbatim. So we should describe that it provides a base implementation for handling callbacks related to events, tracking start and end times, possibly managing parent-child relationships, providing no-op defaults.

Business intent: likely to allow developers to plug in custom behavior for event tracking in LlamaIndex, such as logging, metrics, etc.

Keywords: callback, event tracking, start, end, handler, base class, LlamaIndex, logging, monitoring, parent id, noop.
